# STERIS Corporation (STE) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

STERIS plc is an American-Irish-based medical equipment company specializing in sterilization and surgical products for the US healthcare system. The company is a leading global provider of products and services that support patient care with an emphasis on infection prevention, serving hospitals, other healthcare providers, and pharmaceutical manufacturers. STERIS is operationally headquartered in Mentor, Ohio, and has been legally registered in Dublin, Ireland, for tax purposes since 2018.

As of 2024, the President and CEO is Daniel A. Carestio. STERIS was founded in August 1985 in Ohio, under the name "Innovative Medical Technologies". In November 2020, STERIS acquired Key Surgical, a leading global provider of sterile processing, operating room, and endoscopy products. In June 2021, STERIS acquired Cantel Medical Corporation a provider of infection prevention products and services to endoscopy, dental and dialysis. As of November 2025, its market capitalization stands at approximately $23.4 billion, with about 98.49 million shares outstanding. The company has more than 17,000 Associates worldwide and has 17,787 total employees.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

STERIS operates in three segments: Healthcare, Applied Sterilization Technologies (AST), and Life Sciences. The Healthcare segment offers cleaning chemistries and sterility assurance products; automated endoscope reprocessing system and tracking products; endoscopy accessories, washers, sterilizers, and other pieces of capital equipment for the operation of a sterile processing department; and equipment used directly in procedure rooms, including surgical tables, lights, and connectivity solutions, as well as equipment management services.

The Life Sciences segment designs, manufactures, and sells consumable products, such as pharmaceutical detergents, cleanroom disinfectants and sterilants, pharmaceutical grade and research sterilizers and washers, sterility assurance and maintenance products, vaporized hydrogen peroxide room decontamination systems and sterilizers, and high purity water and pure steam generators. This segment also offers equipment installation, maintenance, upgradation, repair, and troubleshooting services; and preventive maintenance programs and repair services.

STERIS possesses a promising array of sterilization products and services within its portfolio. Additionally, STERIS offers a diverse selection of contract processing services, such as electron beam processing, gamma irradiation utilization, and EtO technologies, alongside a variety of laboratory testing services.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

Significant investment in research and development fuels the company's innovation pipeline. In fiscal year 2024, STERIS allocated $211.7 million to R&D, underscoring its commitment to technological advancement. The company prioritizes creating new and improved products and services.

Research and development efforts focus on enhancing sterile processing technologies, procedural products, and endoscopy support accessories. Continuous innovation drives replacement demand and supports premium pricing. The company's development of faster cycle times, improved connectivity for compliance tracking, and more efficient chemistries directly translates into customer ROI, justifying higher average selling prices and maintaining gross margins above 44% despite inflationary pressures.

## 5. Growth Strategy

STERIS plc's growth strategy is deeply rooted in expanding its market presence and diversifying its revenue streams through a combination of organic development and strategic acquisitions. The company consistently seeks opportunities to enhance its healthcare product offerings, aiming to solidify its position in key medical sectors.

Growth strategy includes targeted acquisitions to enhance product offerings in operating room and sterile processing, leveraging growth in the Applied Sterilization Technologies (AST) division, capitalizing on anticipated demand in the bioprocessing sector, focusing on international market penetration in Europe, the Middle East, and Asia Pacific, and consistent history of strategic M&A for portfolio optimization, as seen with the Cantel Medical acquisition.

There is a growing emphasis on service-based revenue streams. These include equipment maintenance, reusable instrument repair, and outsourced instrument reprocessing, which are increasingly gaining traction.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

STERIS serves its products and services to hospitals, other healthcare providers, and pharmaceutical manufacturers. Healthcare providers, pharmaceutical companies, and medical device companies constitute the major end users of STERIS's products and services. The company operates worldwide, serving customers in the UK, US, and over 100 countries around the world.

The company derives majority of its revenues from North America, specifically the US. Geographically, it is concentrated in the US ($4B), with significant exposure in Ireland and other foreign markets totaling over $1.4B.

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

Total revenue from continuing operations for the second quarter of fiscal 2026 increased 10% to $1.5 billion compared with $1.3 billion in the second quarter of fiscal 2025. Constant currency organic revenue growth from continuing operations for the second quarter was 9%. Steris PLC (STE, Financial) reported a 10% growth in total as-reported revenue for the second quarter, with constant currency organic revenue growing by 9%.

The company's gross margin increased by 60 basis points to 44.3%, driven by positive pricing and productivity. Adjusted earnings per diluted share from continuing operations rose by 15% to $2.47. Free cash flow for the first half of fiscal 2026 was strong at $527.7 million, driven by increased earnings and improvements in working capital. STERIS's cash flow also showed positive trends, with net cash provided by operations reaching $707.8 million for the first half of fiscal 2026, up from $554.4 million in the previous year.

In 2024, STERIS's revenue was $5.46 billion, an increase of 6.24% compared to the previous year's $5.14 billion. Earnings were $614.64 million, an increase of 62.50%. From 2021 to 2025, STERIS plc exhibited strong revenue growth of 75.7%, with a 6.2% increase in the latest year, signaling steady top-line expansion. Net income rose 54.7% overall, supported by a favorable 52.9% rise in net margin last year despite a slight 12% margin contraction over the full period.

Constant currency organic revenue from continuing operations is now anticipated to grow 7-8% compared with prior expectations of 6-7%. Adjusted earnings per diluted share from continuing operations are also increasing and are now expected to be in the range of $10.15 to $10.30 compared with prior expectations of $9.90 to $10.15.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

### Headwinds:
Included in this outlook is the negative impact of tariffs, estimated to reduce pre-tax profit by approximately $45 million, unchanged from prior outlook. With nearly 30% of the company's revenues and costs of revenues being generated outside the United States, foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations can significantly impact STE's financial position, results of operations and competitive position. For instance, ongoing geopolitical instability, such as Russia's invasion of Ukraine, has negatively impacted the global and U.S. economies, leading to supply-chain disruptions, rising interest rates, volatility in capital markets and foreign currency exchange rates, and heightened cybersecurity risks.

### Tailwinds:
The sterilization equipment market is driven by the growing number of surgeries, rising incidence of hospital-acquired infections (HAIs) and increasing outsourcing of sterilization services among pharmaceutical companies, medical device manufacturers, and hospitals. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), of every 100 hospitalized patients at any given time, seven patients in developed countries and ten patients in developing countries acquire at least one healthcare-associated or hospital-acquired infection.

This strong trajectory reflects rising healthcare-associated infection (HAI) rates, growing global surgical volumes, and the heightened focus on sterile processing—particularly in medical device and pharmaceutical manufacturing. As outsourcing becomes a preferred model for efficient, cost-effective sterilization, the industry is undergoing strategic transformation, technological modernization, and regulatory evolution.

STERIS plc (NYSE: STE) ("STERIS" or the "Company") today announced that the Company has entered into a definitive agreement to divest its Dental segment to Peak Rock Capital, a leading middle-market private investment firm, for $787.5 million (the "Transaction"). The Transaction terms also include the opportunity for STERIS to receive an additional earnout of up to $12.5 million, subject to the achievement of certain revenue targets of the Dental segment in fiscal 2025. The Dental segment reported revenue of $407 million and contributed segment operating income of $86 million in the trailing twelve-month period ended December 31, 2023.

Steris' largest acquisition to date was in 2014, when it acquired Synergy Health for $1.9B. It's largest disclosed sale occurred in 2024, when it sold Hu-Friedy Mfg. to Peak Rock Capital for $788M.
